page.title: 10NEW HOMES FROM OLD SCHOOL
page.content: Lillington's old Victorian school building has been given a new lease of life. For generations its five class rooms, and tiny upstairs flat for the teacher, served the community. Now, standing a mere hundred yards from the new Middle and First Schools, its future looked bleak when the last children moved out just two years ago. A transformation has taken place! Roofs have been repaired. Old windows have been replaced, partition walls erected and new doorways have been made. Kitchens have been equipped and central heating installed. The primitive outside toilets have been demolished and builders have laboured on the deserted playground. The result? Fourteen new homes ideal for newly weds or old couples, and a building full of character and local history saved for the future.
